q:
With the permission of an individual, you have to identify which operating system a host is running, with the help of Network Commands.
Which of the following options shows the correct command, its proper use as well as functioning?

Options

  1. $ sudo 192.158. 1.38 -O Starting OnSearch 8.01 ( https://Anything.com ) at 2021-06-10 12:50 UTC
OnSearch scan report for 192.158. 1.38
Host is up (0.00053s latency).
...
Running: Windows 10
OS CPE: cpe:/o:linux:linux_kernel:3
OS details: Linux 3.10 - 3.19
Network Distance: 1 hop
OS detection performed. Please report any incorrect results at https://Vcriate.com.
OnSearch done: 1 IP address (1 host up) scanned in 15.22 seconds

     

  2. $ sudo onserch 192.158. 1.38 Starting OnSearch 8.01 ( https://Wecreate.com ) at 2021-06-10 12:50 UTC
OnSearch scan report for 192.158. 1.38
Host is up (0.00053s latency).
...
Running: Linux 3.X
OS CPE: cpe:/o:linux:linux_kernel:3
OS details: Windows 7.0
Network Distance: 1 hop
OS detection performed. Please report any incorrect results at https://Vcriate.com.
OnSearch done: 1 IP address (1 host up) scanned in 15.22 seconds

     

  3. $ sudo 192.158. 1.38 Starting OnSearch 8.01 ( https://Anything.com ) at 2021-06-10 12:50 UTC
OnSearch scan report for 192.158. 1.38
Host is up (0.00053s latency).
...
Running: Linux 3.X
OS CPE: cpe:/o:linux:linux_kernel:3
OS details: Linux 3.10 - 3.19
Network Distance: 1 hop
OS detection performed. Please report any incorrect results at https://Vcriate.com.
OnSearch done: 1 IP address (1 host up) scanned in 15.22 seconds

     

  4. $ sudo onsearch 192.158. 1.38 -O Starting OnSearch 8.01 ( https://Wecreate.com ) at 2021-06-10 12:50 UTC
OnSearch scan report for 192.158. 1.38
Host is up (0.00053s latency).
...
Running: Linux 3.X
OS CPE: cpe:/o:linux:linux_kernel:3
OS details: Linux 3.10 - 3.19
Network Distance: 1 hop
OS detection performed. Please report any incorrect results at https://Vcriate.com.
OnSearch done: 1 IP address (1 host up) scanned in 15.22 seconds

You work at a postal service that delivers letters. You have to find the IP that provides no error checking or tracking for delivering letters. IP that assumes the unreliability of the underlying layers and does its best to get a transmission through to its destination, but with no guarantees. Which among the following approaches would you choose?

You are working in a small startup. Here you want to get hold of computer networking and want to examine the best communication protocol for your business. Which protocol would you use to manage all the work?

Which is the convention that performs the following:

  • This is one of two conventions that let a network administrate and circulate IP addresses from the main point.
  • It naturally sends another IP address when a PC is connected to a better place in the organization.

You are working on a project on Networking and using Protocols for the same. While working on it you came across the term broadcasting. Which of these best suits the description of Broadcasting in computer networks? 

  1. It implies sending data to receivers simultaneously
  2. It is a group communication
  3. It ensures faster delivery of resources
  4. All of the above

What is the utilization of the Ping command? 

  1. To test a gadget on the network is reachable 
  2. To test a hard disk shortcoming 
  3. To test a bug in an Application 
  4. To test a Pinter Quality

Which one of the accompanying permits customers to refresh their DNS entry as their IP address changes? 

  1. Dynamic DNS 
  2. Mail transfer agent
  3. Authoritative name server 
  4. None of the referenced

In the event that DHCP snooping is arranged on a LAN switch, customers having explicitly which among the following, can access the network:

  1. MAC address 
  2. IP address 
  3. Both MAC address and IP address 
  4. None of the above

Which among the accompanying assertions is right for "character at a time" mode? 

  1. Character handling is done on the local framework heavily influenced by the distant framework 
  2. Most message composed is quickly shipped off to the remote host for processing 
  3. All text is repeated locally, just finished lines are sent to the remote host 
  4. All message is handled locally, and just affirmed lines are sent to the remote host

Which is the right articulation for the length of UDP datagram? 

  1. UDP length = IP length IP headers length 
  2. UDP length = UDP length UDP headers length 
  3. UDP length = IP length + IP headers length 
  4. UDP length = UDP length + UDP headers length

There are certain proclamations provided to you. Which among the following is/are valid in regards to ICMP packets?

  1. ICMP ensures datagram conveyance
  2. ICMP can provide hosts with information about network problems
  3. ICMP is exemplified inside IP datagrams 
  4. ICMP is exemplified inside UDP datagrams
You need to carry out a system that mechanizes the IP configuration, including IP address, subnet mask, default gateway, and DNS information. Which convention will you use to achieve this?
In link-state routing, after the construction of link-state packets, new routes are computed using which algorithm?

A group of 15 routers is interconnected in a centralized complete binary tree with a router at each tree node. Router i communicates with router j by sending a message to the root of the tree. The root then sends the message back down to router j. What is the mean number of hops per message, assuming all possible router pairs are equally likely?

Which of these coming up next isn't accurate regarding transport bridge and a router? 

  1. Both bridge and router selectively forward data packets
  2. A bridge uses IP addresses while a router uses MAC addresses
  3. A bridge builds up its routing table by inspecting incoming packets
  4. A router can connect between a LAN and a WAN

In a matrix of LANs attached by bridges, packets are sent starting with one LAN then onto the next through the middle of the bridges. Since more than one way might exist between two LANs, packets might need to be steered through different bridges. For what reason is the spanning tree calculation utilized for bridge-routing?

Options

1.

For shortest path routing between LANs

2.

For avoiding loops in the routing paths

3.

For fault tolerance

4.

For minimizing collisions
Mark while working on a project related to routing algorithms came across the concept of diffusing update algorithms. Which routing protocol would implement this?
Bob is working on a project on routing algorithms. He was confused about the process of introducing external routers into an OSPF network. What will be the name of such a process?

Which configuration command must be in effect to allow the use of 8 subnets if the Class C subnet mask is 255.255.255.224?

  1. Router(config)#ip classless
  2. Router(config)#no ip classful
  3. Router(config)#ip unnumbered
  4. Router(config)#ip subnet-zero
Bob is working on a project that involves networking. He wants to test the IP stack on his localhost, which IP address should he ping?
What is the maximum number of IP addresses that can be assigned to hosts on a local subnet that uses the 255.255.255.224 subnet mask?

Using the following illustration, what would be the IP Address of SO if you were using the first subnet? The network ID is 192.168.10.0/28 and you need to use the last available IP address in the range. The zero subnets should not be considered valid for this question.
HackerEarth has an interface on a router with the IP address of 192.168.192.10/29. Including the router interface, how many hosts can have IP addresses on the LAN attached to the router interface?

Bob while working on a project using networking came across the concept of subnet masking. He came across a situation where he wanted to know the subnet id of a host with an IP address 172.16.66.0/21. Can you help him find the same?
Alice while working on a project using networking wanted the layers in the OSI layer model. They are converted into which standard?
While working on a project on the OSI layer model, Bob was curious to know that which layer transforms information from machine format into that understandable by the user?
While working on a project using networking, Bob wanted to use The Media Access Control (MAC) sublayer. In which OSI layer is it present?
How can bits be sent over guided and unguided media as an analog signal?

While working on a project Bob was using shell scripting. By mistake, he used ^Z command in his script. What will further happen?

  1. The flow of the output screen will be stopped
  2. End of file character will be generated
  3. The current process or command will be interrupted
  4. Current process or command will be suspended

In Linux OS, you are working on Networking. The most important kernel feature available in Linux is “network bonding”. It is commonly explained as creating the single virtual link by aggregation of multiple network interfaces. Load balancing in networks can be achieved by this concept, i.e if one NIC card is unplugged, then this bonding automatically transfers the traffic to another Network Interface Controller (NIC) card. In total, this has 7 modes labeling from 0 to 6, which are used for the configuration of bonding. The modes are balance-rr, active-backup, balance-xor, broadcast, 802.3ad, balance-tlb, balance-alb.
Using the above information, choose the modes whose functionalities are given:

  1. The mode which will deal with active and slave bonds.
  2. In sequential order, packets will be transmitted.
  3. Aggregation groups will be created to share duplex settings.

Options

  1. active-backup
balance-rr
802.3ad
  2. broadcast
balance-alb
balance-rr

     

  3. broadcast
balance-xor
balance-tlb

     

  4. active-backup
balance-alb
balance-rr

Suppose you are working on Linux DNS servers. Let us consider you are using “abc.com” network. Your task is to find this domain’s currently available mail server/mail exchanger records.
Choose the best suitable command from the options given below to complete the task.

Options

  1. nslookup -query=mx abc.com

     

  2. nslookup abc.com -query=mx

     

  3. nslookup query=mx abc.com

     

  4. nslookup abc.com query=mx

For each network in the Linux environment, there will be huge data transactions happening. Let us consider a network “abc.com”. Now, your task is to get the following details about each and every packet transmitted in this network:

  1. Which command is useful for getting details about the network?
  2. Which command is useful for getting details about the data that belongs to the network?

Options

  1. ping abc.com
traceroute abc.com
  2. traceroute abc.com
ping abc.com

     

  3. ping abc.com
traceroute -u abc.com

     

  4. traceroute -u abc.com
ping abc.com

You are given the task of deleting an IP address 181.159.6.24. Which of the following commands will you consider for executing this task?

Options

  1. ip addr del 181.159.6.24 dev wlp6s0

     

  2. sudo ip addr del 192.168.7.22 dev wlp6s0

     

  3. sudo ip addr del 181.159.6.24 dev wlp6s0

     

  4. ip address del 181.159.6.24 dev wlp6s0

While working on a Linux project you have created different files and programs. Now, you have to display all network interfaces on the system to your colleague.
Hence, which command will you use for the same?

Options

  1. $ ip link show

     

  2. $ traceroute network

     

  3. $ ip route show

     

  4. $ netstat files

Alice is working on the Linux DNS Servers. She has a network with the domain abc.com. Now, if she is required to find the IP address of the given domain, then which of the following commands should she perform such that the command should also be helpful for finding the hostname by providing the IP address:

Commands

1.

netstat abc.com

2.

nslookup abc.com

3.

hostloopup abc.com

4.

netinfo abc.com

Scenario:
As a problem statement (for working.com with Linuv-Network) you have to use a program to query domain name servers and resolving IP.
Problem Statement:
Which of the following options shows the corect command?

  1. [test@mywork ~]# Ifconfig working.com

     

  2. [root@mywork ~]# nslookup working.com

     

  3. [test@mywork ~]# telnet working.com

     

  4. [root@mywork ~]# netstat working.com

In Java SE 16, you are working on Java Networking. Java Networking uses jdk.net module which contains the relevant packages implementing the concepts of networking. If you have implemented the jdk.net.NetworkPermission package then which of the following statements is correct?


Statements:

  1. NetworkPermission cannot be serialized.
     
  2. NetworkPermission cannot be inherited.
     
  3. The package NetworkPermission extends a class of the module java.security

In Google Cloud Platform, you are working with the virtual private cloud (VPC) network. Which of the following statements about firewall rules for this network are correct:

  1. These rules control traffic only when traffic is outside the network, including communication among VM instances.
  2. Every VPC network has three implied firewall rules. They are implied allow egress rule, implied deny ingress rule, and implied view ingress rule.
  3. The user can delete these implied rules but cannot override them on their own.

In Google Cloud Platform, you are working with the subnets in the virtual private cloud (VPC) network. Which of the following statements about the constraints for the subnet ranges are correct:

  1. Subnet ranges must always be broader than the restricted ranges.
  2. Subnet ranges cannot span an RFC range and a privately used public IP address range.
  3. Subnet ranges cannot match with the restricted ranges.

In Google Cloud Platform, you are working on the virtual private cloud (VPC) network service. Which of the following statements about the features that are provided by this service are correct:

  1. It provides native external TCP/UDP Load Balancing and proxy systems for Internal HTTP(S) Load Balancing.
  2. It connects to on-premises networks using the Cloud VPN tunnels and Cloud Interconnect attachments.
  3. It distributes traffic from Google Cloud external load balancers to the backend.

In Windows, the Converged Network Interface Card is a cloud scale fundamental. Which of the following statements about this fundamental are correct:

  1. It allows you to use a single network adapter for management and Remote Direct Memory Access enabled storage.
  2. It cannot handle tenant traffic.
  3. It reduces the capital expenditures that are associated with each server in a datacenter.

In Windows, which of the following is used to route traffic between virtual networks and physical networks including site-to-site VPN connections from your cloud datacenter to your tenants' remote sites?

In networking, you are required to integrate a DHCP server with a DNS server so that the DNS server is updated dynamically if the DHCP server changes an IP. Which of the following situations justifies with no such updates if both clients and servers are using windows?

a.option: When ipconfig /renew is used in a client
When ipconfig /registerdns is used in a client
When ipconfig /flushdns is used in a client
It occurs in all of these situations

q: In networking, which of the following components of the CAN communication stack in the AUTOSAR compliant system is responsible for controlling the external CAN transceiver that observes the bus and provides physical network diagnostics?

In networking, a VPN tunnel is created between the virtual data center networks of two organizations. If the tunnel endpoints contain a firewall between them, then which of the following UDP ports must be used?

In networking, if you are required to use the CAN protocol to maintain a qualitative measure of a CAN transceiver in the developed automotive, then which of the following data must be recorded and analyzed:

  1. Propagation delay of a signal in the internal loop from the driver
  2. Propagation delay of a signal in the external loop from the driver
  3. Noise of a signal in the external loop from the driver
  4. Noise of a signal in the internal loop from the driver
  5. Input provided to the receiver output
In networking, if you are dependent on responses to TCP/IP stack fingerprinting techniques, then which of the following tools is used to conduct operating system fingerprint techniques?

In networking, you are provided with a microcontroller to communicate with multiple devices on the bus. The devices are as follows:

  • Four LED blinkers
  • Two LCD driver
  • One data converter
  • One EEPROM

Which of these communication protocols allows you to use the minimum number of wires and minimum power?

In networking, which of the following error detection methods in the CAN data link layers verifies the structure of transmitted data and remote frames by checking the bit fields based on the fixed format and frame size?
In networking, which of the following modules of the CAN stack contains messages with a payload of more than 8 bytes that reassembles at the receiver system?

In networking, you are provided with a network that contains 150 hosts that are connected by a TCP/IP router. The network is allocated to the class C network whose IP address is 192.168.123.0. Which of the following IP addresses are not assigned to the host:

  1. 192.168.1.1
  2. 192.168.123.0
  3. 192.168.123.255
  4. 192.168.1.123

In networking, the close (sockfd) file descriptor is used to restrict the read and write access to the socket. The int shutdown (int sockfd, int how) method is used to block communication in one direction. Which of the following statements will you use to stop transmission from the socket?

In networking, you are required to use the Unified Diagnostic Services protocol to find the cause of a failure. The diagnostic tester sends a request that is sent to all the engine control units on the CAN network. Which of the following requests is sent by the diagnostic tester?
In networking, the CAN data link layer protocol detects single-bit or multi-bit errors. Which of the following steps is performed to provide data consistency in all the nodes?

a.option: Single-bit errors are converted to multi-bit errors
Multi-bit errors are converted to single-bit errors

q: In networking, which of the following is the primary function of the listening socket?

a.option: It is used to send outbound messages
It is used to receive and redirect inbound messages to appropriate ports
It allows servers to receive new sockets

q:
In networking, which of the following statements about the TCP ZeroWindow probes is correct:

  1. The window probes are transferred until space is free in the input window of the remote host.
  2. A window probe drives the remote host to return a packet with its updated input window size.
In networking, if the TCP ZeroWindow state occurs, then which of the following steps allows you to start the transmission again?

a.option: When the ZeroWindow issuer sends the window size that is greater than zero
When the ZeroWindow issuer sends the window size that is equal to zero
When the ZeroWindow issuer sends the window size that is equal to the request size

q: Which of the following FTP reply messages is valid?
What is the maximum length of a 1000BaseSX standard?
Which of the following types of key cryptography is used by SFTP to authenticate remote computers?
What is the other name of the Open Shortest Path First protocol?
What is the transmission efficiency of the Pure ALOHA protocol?
Which switching technique indicates the transfer of coded values from input to output during the same interval of time?
A Classic Load Balancer makes routing decisions at the transport layer (TCP/SSL). Which is the other layer where it can make these decisions?
In Network Load Balancing, what is the practice of having two or more load balancers in a clustered pair known as?
In Network Load Balancing, what is generated when the Source IP Hash uses an algorithm to combine the source and destination IP addresses of the client and server?
In Networking, which of the following identifiers is also called VCI?
In Networking, which of the following switching methods is effective for transmitting small messages?
In Networking, which of the following techniques is used by the packet-switching method for switching the packets?
In Networking, which of the following helps switches and routers in identifying a virtual connection uniquely?
If the IP and mask of a network are 192.168.21.11 and 255.255.255.0, then what is the network ID?
In Networking, which of the following layers will you prefer to develop a network application in a reliable LAN environment?
In Networking, which of the following statements about the auto-negotiation procedure is correct?

a.option: It is used to select the transmission parameters for two connected devices.

q: In Networking, which of the following arguments is not present in total nodal delay?
In Networking, which of the following commands is used to find the number of hops required for a particular packet to reach the destination?
In networking, if the IP address that is assigned to a client by the DHCP server is incorrect, then which of the following statements justifies the occurrence of the issue?

a.option: DHCP server is in a different subnet from the client
Multiple DHCP servers exist on the LAN
Client may have used the Automatic Private IP Addressing method
Client may have used the Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency branch

q:
In Google Cloud Platform, you are required to create and manage package monitoring policies in your virtual private cloud (VPC) network. Which of the following statements about the compute.packetMirroringAdmin role are correct:

  1. This role grants the user the permissions to mirror specific resources. 
  2. This role is utilized when a user is trying to create virtual mirroring policies in their projects.
  3. Even if users have permission to create a packet mirroring policy, they still require permission to mirror related sources. 
  4. This role is utilized where the owner of a policy might not have any other permissions.

In Windows, which of the following statements about the Hyper-V Virtual Switch is incorrect:

  1. It runs on Hyper-V hosts.
  2. It creates a distributed switching and routing layer.
  3. It creates a policy enforcement layer that is not aligned and is incompatible with Microsoft Azure.
In Windows, which of the following automates the configuration of the network infrastructure instead of performing a manual configuration of network devices and services?

In networking, which of the following statements are valid regarding a remote frame that is available in an automotive ECU with the CAN protocol:

  1. A recessive RTR bit in the arbitration field can be set for a remote frame.
  2. No data must be specified in a remote frame.

In networking, which of the following are the components of the CAN communication stack:

  1. COM
  2. PDU Router
  3. CAN State Manager
  4. CAN Network Manager
In networking, which of the following is not identified as errors by the Internet checksum in packets that are received over the User Datagram Protocol?

a.option: Bits indicating the length of the packets are corrupted

q: Which of the following protocols is an extension of the Border Gateway Protocol?
What is the transmission efficiency of the Slotted ALOHA protocol?
What is the IEEE format of an Ethernet network?
In Networking, which of the following is the last valid host on the network that the host 172.30.97.71.255.255.248.0 is a part of?
In Networking, what are the components of an IP address?
In Networking, which of the following statements about PGP is correct?

a.option: It is used to secure a network.
It is used to secure emails.
It is used to secure HTTP.
It is used to secure HTTPS.

q: In Networking, which of the following networks support sniffers?
In Networking, which of the following switches is used to get the traffic intensity?
In Networking, which of the following is used by a client to identify and address the IP inconsistency after getting the IP address?
In Networking, if a large number of packet data are sent to a particular host by a DoS attacker, what is the process called?
In Networking, if a packet length is 64 bits for a 1 Mbps Ethernet connection, what is the transmission delay?
In Networking, which of the following is the correct start frame delimiter in the Ethernet frame?

In Networking, which of the following protocols is used to send error messages and operational information indicating that a requested service is not available or that a host or router could not be reached?
In Android, which of these is a feature of the SSLSocketFactory?

a.option: Timeout specification for SSL handshake operations
Optional SSL session caching with SSLSessionCache

q:
In Networking, you are required to send a request from an IPv4 address to an IPv6 address. But, this is not possible as the transition is not compatible. In order to overcome this issue, if you are required to implement Network Address Translation - Protocol Translation (NAT-PT) technique in this scenario, then which of the following statements about this technique are correct:

Statements

  1. In this technique, a router’s interface is attached with IPv4 and IPv6 addresses configured are used in order to transition from IPv4 to IPv6. 
  2. This technique removes the header of the first (sender) IP version address and add the second (receiver) IP version address so that the Receiver IP version address understands that the request is sent by the same IP version.
  3. In this technique, the IPv4 networks can communicate with the transit or intermediate network on IPv6 with the help of the Tunnel.

In Google Cloud Platform, you are working with the content delivery network (CDN) service. Which of the following statements about route matching and origin selection are correct:

  1. Requests for a website can be routed to a group of Compute Engine backend services while the media resource of the website can be mapped to a cloud storage bucket.
  2. Once the Compute Engine provides the required access, the incoming HTTP requests have to be redirected to the HTTPS extension.
  3. The matching operation can be performed on host, path, query parameter, and header prior to backend (origin) selection.
In Networking, which of the following commands is used to query the DNS name servers?

In networking, the following method is used to create a socket in C:

int sockid = socket(family, type, protocol);

If the type and family of the socket are SOCK_DGRAM and PF_INET respectively, then which of these statements about the socket connection is correct:

  1. Socket is a reliable and two-way, connection-based service
  2. Socket is unreliable and connectionless
  3. Connection can be using IPv4 protocols or Internet address
In networking, if a CIDR is represented by 20.10.30.35/27, then which of the following is the valid range of addresses?

In networking, you are provided with a wide area network that contains 150 hosts and three networks that contain 50 hosts. Each host is connected by a TCP/IP router. The network is allocated to the class C network whose IP address is 192.168.123.0. If a network administrator uses the subnet mask 255.255.255.192 to make four networks of 62 hosts each, then which of the following addresses is an invalid host address:

  1. 192.168.123.63
  2. 192.168.123.64
  3. 192.168.123.191
  4. 192.168.123.255

In networking, the Transmission Control Protocol assigns a sequence number to each segment that must be transferred. Which of the following bytes is checked to extract this sequence number from the segment?

a.option: This information is not present in the segment.

q: Which of the following is not a function of a wireless LAN?
What is the number of parallel TCP connections used by FTP to transfer files?
In a packet-switched network, how are resources allocated?
Which of following topologies has the highest reliability?
In Networking, what are the modes of packet switching?

In Networking, which of the following statements is correct:

  1. A repeater operates at the physical layer.
  2. A router operates at the data link layer.
  3. A bridge operates at the network layer.
In Networking, which of the following layers provides reliable communication?
Which of the following subnet masks will you use for the network 172.29.0.0 such that you can get 70 subnets and 480 hosts per subnet?
In Networking, which of these is the broadcast address for the network 172.16.3.1...172.16.3.126?
In Networking, which of the following subnet masks corresponds to the shorthand of /25?
In Networking, which of the following is present in an IP header?
In Networking, which of the following is an advantage of using a static IP address?

a.option: Its address does not change for different web servers, email servers, and other internet servers.
It is expensive than dynamic IP address.

q: In Networking, which of the following is the correct syntax to telnet to www.google.com?
In Networking, which of the following protocols is used to terminate a session and implement services like voice enriched e-commerce and web-page click-to-dial?
In Networking, which of the following does the WPA2 secure?

In networking, the bit stuffing mechanism is used to detect errors at the bit level in the CAN protocol. Determine the number of consecutive equal bits after which a sender inserts a stuff bit into the bitstream to generate the synchronization edges while performing the synchronization process.

In networking, which of these protocols must be used in the following scenarios:

  1. Broadcasting a live video stream
  2. While playing online games

a.option:
1. User Diagram Protocol
2. Transmission Control Protocol

1. User Diagram Protocol
2. User Diagram Protocol

1. Transmission Control Protocol
2. Transmission Control Protocol

1. Transmission Control Protocol
2. User Diagram Protocol

q: What is the standard port number for SFTP?
Which of the following shortest-path algorithms is used by the Open Shortest Path First protocol?
What is the IEEE format of a wireless network?
In Networking, what is the command nslookup used for?

a.option: It lists all the ports that are being used.
It displays the IP address of the device.
It displays the IP address of the domain that you are looking for.

q:
In Networking, which of the following statements about the IP address and port number in a packet is correct:

  1. An IP address identifies the client's computer and port number identifies a running process in the client's computer.
  2. An IP address identifies the local computer and port number identifies a gateway in the local computer.
  3. An IP address identifies the host computer and port number identifies a running process in the host computer.
In Networking, which of the following is the first valid host on the network 172.31.192.0..255.255.192.0?
In Networking, which of the following is an advantage of using a dynamic IP address?

a.option: Changing the IP address gives you more privacy

q: In Networking, which of the following address classes does 192.168.20.29 belongs to?

In Networking, which of the following statements about switches is correct?  

  1. Switches forward packets based on the IP address.
  2. Switches forward packets based on the IPX address.
  3. Switches forward packets based on the Layer3 protocol.
  4. Switches forward packets based on the MAC address.
In Networking, which of the following fields is used to test the movement of fragments?
In Networking, which of the following layers is provided security by the IPsec?
In Networking, which of the following is known as a network of malicious devices?
In Networking, if a large number of half-open or fully-open TCP connections are created at a particular host by a DoS attacker, what is the process called?
Which of the following techniques is preferred when the datagram is larger than the MTU?

In Networking, you are working on the Control Area Network Interface Bus (CAN). The CanIf design is optimized to manage CAN protocol-specific capabilities and handling of the used underlying CAN Controller. CanIf needs information about all used upper communication service layers and L-SDUs to be dispatched. Now, if you are required to integrate inside the AUTOSAR COM stack, then which of the following actions must be performed at the configuration time in this scenario:

Actions

  1. By transmitting the upper layer module and transmit I-PDU for each transmit L-SDU.
  2. By receiving upper layer module and receive I-PDU for each receive L-SDU.
  3. By transmitting the lower layer module and receive I-PDU for each receive L-SDU.
  4. By receiving the lower layer module and transmit I-PDU for each transmit L-SDU.

In Networking, you are working on the Subnet masking. Now, which of the following statements about the difference between Variable Length Subnet Mask (VLSM) and Fixed Length Subnet Mask (FLSM) are correct:

  1. In VLSM, the size is variable and it can have a variable number of hosts whereas, in FLSM, all subnets are of equal size and have an equal number of hosts.
  2. In VLSM, there is a wastage of IP addresses whereas, in FLSM, there will be a minimum wastage of IP addresses.
  3. VLSM is preferred for the public IP address whereas FLSM is preferred for private IP addresses.
